question: What is a reusable resource?
options: ['a) that can be used by one process at a time and is not depleted by that use', 'b) that can be used by more than one process at a time', 'c) that can be shared between various threads', 'd) none of the mentioned']
option1: a) that can be used by one process at a time and is not depleted by that use
option2: b) that can be used by more than one process at a time
option3: c) that can be shared between various threads

question: Which of the following condition is required for a deadlock to be possible?
options: ['a) mutual exclusion', 'b) a process may hold allocated resources while awaiting assignment of other resources', 'c) no resource can be forcibly removed from a process holding it', 'd) all of the mentioned']
option2: b) a process may hold allocated resources while awaiting assignment of other resources
option3: c) no resource can be forcibly removed from a process holding it

question: A system is in the safe state if ____________
options: ['a) the system can allocate resources to each process in some order and still avoid a deadlock', 'b) there exist a safe sequence', 'c) all of the mentioned', 'd) none of the mentioned']
option1: a) the system can allocate resources to each process in some order and still avoid a deadlock
option2: b) there exist a safe sequence

question: The circular wait condition can be prevented by ____________
options: ['a) defining a linear ordering of resource types', 'b) using thread', 'c) using pipes', 'd) all of the mentioned']
option1: a) defining a linear ordering of resource types

question: Which one of the following is the deadlock avoidance algorithm?
options: ['a) banker’s algorithm', 'b) round-robin algorithm', 'c) elevator algorithm', 'd) karn’s algorithm']

question: What is the drawback of banker’s algorithm?
options: ['a) in advance processes rarely know how much resource they will need', 'b) the number of processes changes as time progresses', 'c) resource once available can disappear', 'd) all of the mentioned']
option1: a) in advance processes rarely know how much resource they will need
option2: b) the number of processes changes as time progresses
option3: c) resource once available can disappear

question: For an effective operating system, when to check for deadlock?
options: ['a) every time a resource request is made', 'b) at fixed time intervals', 'c) every time a resource request is made at fixed time intervals', 'd) none of the mentioned']
option1: a) every time a resource request is made
option3: c) every time a resource request is made at fixed time intervals

question: A problem encountered in multitasking when a process is perpetually denied necessary resources is called ____________
Which one of the following is a visual ( mathematical ) way to determine the deadlock occurrence?
options: ['a) resource allocation graph', 'b) starvation graph', 'c) inversion graph', 'd) none of the mentioned']

question: To avoid deadlock ____________
options: ['a) there must be a fixed number of resources to allocate', 'b) resource allocation must be done only once', 'c) all deadlocked processes must be aborted', 'd) inversion technique can be used']
option1: a) there must be a fixed number of resources to allocate
option2: b) resource allocation must be done only once
option3: c) all deadlocked processes must be aborted
option4: d) inversion technique can be used
